org.apache.juneau.uon

Class UonSerializerContext

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.apache.juneau.Context
      • org.apache.juneau.BeanContext
        • org.apache.juneau.serializer.SerializerContext
          • org.apache.juneau.uon.UonSerializerContext
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    UrlEncodingSerializerContext

    public class UonSerializerContext
extends SerializerContext
    Configurable properties on the UonSerializer class.

    Context properties are set by calling PropertyStore.setProperty(String, Object) on the property store passed into the constructor.

    See PropertyStore for more information about context properties.

    Inherited configurable properties:
    • BeanContext - Properties associated with handling beans on serializers and parsers.
      • SerializerContext - Configurable properties common to all serializers.

    • Field Detail

      • UON_encodeChars

        public static final String UON_encodeChars
        Configuration property: Encode non-valid URI characters.

        • Name: "UonSerializer.encodeChars"
        • Data type: Boolean
        • Default: false for UonSerializer, true for UrlEncodingSerializer
        • Session-overridable: true

        Encode non-valid URI characters with "%xx" constructs.

        If true, non-valid URI characters will be converted to "%xx" sequences. Set to false if parameter value is being passed to some other code that will already perform URL-encoding of non-valid URI characters.

        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • UON_addBeanTypeProperties

        public static final String UON_addBeanTypeProperties
        Configuration property: Add "_type" properties when needed.

        • Name: "UonSerializer.addBeanTypeProperties"
        • Data type: Boolean
        • Default: false
        • Session-overridable: true

        If true, then "_type" properties will be added to beans if their type cannot be inferred through reflection. This is used to recreate the correct objects during parsing if the object types cannot be inferred. For example, when serializing a Map<String,Object> field, where the bean class cannot be determined from the value type.

        When present, this value overrides the SerializerContext.SERIALIZER_addBeanTypeProperties setting and is provided to customize the behavior of specific serializers in a SerializerGroup.

        See Also:
        Constant Field Values
